topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack 1.1: Monitor Node Replication Status using Icinga

body.p: Cloud admins can use the icinga service running in the undercloud to monitor the replication status of nodes within the Object Storage (Swift) deployment.

ul.li: HP Helion OpenStack cloud is successfully deployed.(Starter Object Storage (Swift) nodes are functional by default as they are part of cloud deployment.)
The Icinga service is active and running in the undercloud.

section.title: Monitoring Object Storage (Swift) Replication Status
section.p: Perform the following steps to monitor the replication status:

li.p: In the undercloud, log in to the Icinga Dashboard (http://<undercloud_IP>/icinga/). The default login credentials are as follows:

Click Status on the left panel and then click
Host Detail
.

In the Host column, click the icon next to the host IP when the tooltip displays as "View Service Details For This Host". The page navigates to Service Status Details For Host <Swift node IP address > and displays the replication status of the selected Swift node.

row.entry: An account, container or object replicator process has not finished a complete scan within the defined threshold (Default set to 24 hours (86400 seconds) for HP Helion OpenStack 1.0). Examine the account-replicator, container-replicator and object-replicator logs to see which process is "stuck". Usually, restarting the relevant process resolves the issue.
The named replication process has never run on this node. Check that the replicator has been configured and started. Examine the log files to see if the replicator process has reported problems.
